case.title: Search style
case.description: Specify the type of search to perform. 0 = Use default setting specified on Search Properties tab, 1 = 'Exact Match' (may or may not be case sensitive - depends on the database), 2 = 'Is Contained In', 3 = 'Starts with' 4 = 'Wildcard' - user must explicitly enter wildcard characters '*', '%' or '?'. (If QBE syntax is turned on you can enter multiple wildcard criteria, delimited with either a comma or && - use && to combine criteria with an AND clause) For databases that are case-sensitive, you can use 11, 12, 13 or 14 for case-insensitive versions of the 1, 2, 3, or 4 option. You can use negative values (e.g. -1,-2,-3 or -4 to invert the search result (e.g. 'not equals'). For multi-valued fields (e.g. Checkbox and Dropdownbox controls that allow multi-select), 20=combine selections with OR, 21=combine selections with AND. For example, if a Checkbox control has 'Red', 'Green' and 'Blue' as its choices, if you check 'Red' and 'Green' and select option 20, the search is for 'Red' or 'Green' in the field, and if you select 21, the search is for 'Red' and 'Green' in the field. Instead of specifying 20, you can specify 201, 202 or 203. These all combine selections with OR, but allow you to control whether to search for an exact match (201), an 'is contained in' search (202, which is same as 20), or 203 a 'starts with' search.

For example: session.companyName. You can use Page Variables (i.e. the variables defined in the URL) by prefixing the variable name with 'PageVariable.' (e.g. PageVariable.lastname)
